column4: hey i upgraded my system to 8.10 and after i restarted my system i no longer get back my GUI...can anyone help
hey i upgraded my system to 8.10 and after i restarted my system i no longer get back my GUI...can anyone help..right now i am using my live cd
musikgoat|main; hi long time
hello
ask away, if i don't know, someone else may
i upgraded my system to 8.10 and after i restarted my system i no longer get back my GUI...right now i am using my live cd
you could try sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
musikgoat|main; will that surely resolve the problem
no
then i have to restart my system and do that??
then i have to restart my system and do that??
no, just run the command, logout and log back in
then to answer your earlier question, you will have to run that command after you login
you should try reading through your hd's logs to see why it couldn't load the gui
when you are in there...
less /var/log/messages  and read through it for errors to give you more information
yes, if you mount the hard drive (unless it automounted)
sudo
you don't need to ssh
yes, sorry.   check in /media for your hard drives mount name
then gksudo gedit /mount/thatname/var/log/messages
you should have a /media/disk/var/log/messages  use the file manager to check whats in the var/log direcory
